data.name: Moondance
data.description: One of our original recipes, amber coloured best bitter with copious amounts of US Cascade hops. Wonderfully aromatic floral nose balanced by a gentle bitterness with a hint of sweetness. No wonder this beer has won the most awards of all the beers in our range.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Special Bitter or Best Bitter
style.description: Special bitter is more robust than ordinary bitter. It has medium body and medium residual malt sweetness. It is deep gold to copper colored. Hop bitterness should be medium and absent of harshness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels. The absence of diacetyl is also acceptable. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

breweries.name: The Triple FFF Brewery
breweries.description:
Triple fff Brewery was founded in 1997 with the aim of brewing "Real ale that real ale drinkers drink!" 

The brewery near Alton in Hampshire started with two brews to its name. These two ales, Moondance and Comfortably Numb remain to this day among the most popular Triple fff beers. 
 
They have now been joined by other brews including Alton's Pride and Pressed Rat & Warthog along with some brand new recipes such as Jabberwocky and Ramble Tamble

breweries.name: Abigale Brewing Co
breweries.description: Inspired by the hop heritage of nearby Wye and with a particular interest in the flavours of the hop varieties that have been developed at Wye in the past, Abigale Brewing Company craft their ales in the heart of Kent using the finest quality ingredients.

data.name: Nor Cal Ale
data.description: Inspired by Northern California's brewing history, this California Bitter is as inviting as the Redwoods. Smooth and drinkable, this ale has a well rounded malt character accented by Cascade and Centennial dry hops.

breweries.name: Bear Republic Brewing Company
breweries.description: Bear Republic's brews are hand-crafted using traditional brewing methods. We hand select only the choicest ingredients for each batch. The specialty grains and hops used by Bear Republic have been chosen for their unique characteristics. The recipes and their final formulations were developed over a period of several years. Those wonderful homebrewing sessions and the lessons learned from trial and error have established the solid foundations for each recipe's commercial equivalents. It's our goal to continually develop new recipes using our time tested home brewing methods. "I feel home brewing is the laboratory where true advancement of beer styles is coming from. "Richard G. Norgrove, Brewmaster

Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

data.name: Organic Best Bitter
data.description: Soil Association accredited, organically grown barley is used to make the mash for this excellent beer. To provide the distinctive fully hopped flavour we add organically grown hops. The result is a unique, full-bodied organic best bitter with a refreshing after-taste, highly commended by the Soil Association. Gold medal – International Beer & Cider Competition IFE. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

data.name: Organic E.S.B.
data.description:
One of the few beers brewed in the world using 100% certified organic ingredients  including the hops! 

A classic British style Extra Special Bitter that pours a brilliant amber with a nice off-white head. Organic Saphir hops lend a citrusy bite to the malty flavor to yield a very refreshing taste.
data.foodPairings: Goes great with burgers and grilled vegetables, a nice summer meal! Ideal

breweries.name: Lakefront Brewery
breweries.description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987.  The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark.  Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: See Website: http://www.lakefrontbrewery.com/details_details.html

data.name: Polypin Best Bitter
data.description:
Having a wedding, party or celebration? Well a Harveys polypin is the ideal way to set your event apart from the rest. 

Our draught Best is a superbly balanced bitter with a prominent hop character. Our most famous and popular brand - it makes up over 90% of our total brewing capacity. Winner of the Champion Best Bitter of Britain title at CAMRA's Great British Beers Festival in 2005 and 2006.

Polypins can only be delivered between Tuesday and Friday. We recommend you plan to receive the item at least 2-3 working days before your event. Polypins generally have a 6 week shelf-life and require a minimum of 24 hours to settle.

Please note: We also sell this product as 'Bright' beer, which has a shorter shelf life of 2-3 days but does not require settling before consumption. Call our shop on 01273 480 217 for further details and to order.

data.name: Polypin Olympia
data.description:
A cool, golden summer ale. Very refreshing with a balanced complexity. It was first produced in 2005 to celebrate our major summer award at Kensington Olympia for Best Bitter. Olympia was an instant hit and is best served at 11 degrees Celsius. Great as something a bit different at your wedding, party or barbeque this summer!

Polypins can only be delivered between Tuesday and Friday. We recommend you plan to receive the item at least 2-3 working days before your event. Polypins generally have a 6-week shelf-life and require a minimum of 24 hours to settle.

breweries.description:
We are a small brewery and taproom just south of downtown Albuquerque. Our focus is to produce the highest quality beer and serve it in a friendly neighborhood pub atmosphere.

See you soon.

data.name: Red Santa
data.description: Combine St Nicholas and Sinterklaas from church history and folklore and merge with our very own Father Christmas and you get the much loved character known as Santa Claus complete with his splendid white trimmed red coat and trousers. Similarly, combine Crystal Rye malt and Boadicea hops for balancing both aroma and bitterness and you create a first rate, wonderfully crisp and fruity, gloriously red best bitter. Perfect for the festive season.

data.name: Red Spruce Bitter
data.description:
Lawson’s  winter holiday ale is a special bitter brewed with Maine-grown barely, Liberty hops, real sprigs of Red Spruce picked from trees at the brewery, a dash of cinnamon & fermeneted with an English-style yeast.
This winter seasonal breaks from traditionally heavy holiday brews with a light body and refreshing zest. Enjoy!

breweries.name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
breweries.description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

data.name: Resolute Bitter
data.description: Taking its name from a town within the high Arctic, despite its cool name this is the sort of bitter that we’re sure you’ll easily warm to. Andwell’s Best Bitter combines the finest malt and hops to produce a well balanced malty and hoppy flavour with a light amber colour.

breweries.name: Andwells Brewery
breweries.description:
Andwell Brewing Company is a true family business, run by Adam Komrower and his wife, Helen.  Andwell’s brewed its first beer in October 2008. Since then, Andwell’s has established a reputation for consistently producing beers of the highest quality

Andwell's run guided Brewery Tours where you can discover some of the secrets of brewing, touch and taste the floor-malted hand-raked barley, take in the sweet aroma of hops and sample some of Hampshire’s finest beers.

data.name: Ridleys Old Bob

"Old Bob is a noted strong premium ale. Only the finest East Anglian pale ale malt and fuggles hops are used to create this full-bodied, rich and spicy beer."
A Ridley’s beer, brewed at Greene King since late 2005.

data.name: Royal Brat
data.description: Brace yourself for the extreme quaffability, severe mellowness, and aggressive tenderness in this loving embrace between two of Indiana’s most celebrated breweries. Brewers from Sun King and Three Floyds came together to produce this belligerently sessionable English-Style Best Bitter, brewed to celebrate the Sun King CANvitational.

breweries.name: Three Floyds Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards.

In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

breweries.name: The Old Cannon Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a privately owned, genuinely independent free house in Bury and certainly the only brew pub in Suffolk where you can actually see beer in the making on a regular basis. Beers are made on the premises using East Anglian grown and ma

The Brewery does not specifically cater for young children and under 14s are not allowed in the bar at any time - however, at the manager's discretion, family groups are welcome to lunch together on Saturdays and Sundays.

Dogs are always welcome in the beer garden but only in the bar on a Sunday evening.

The Old Cannon, including the Brewery Rooms, is smoke-free. We have a designated smoking area with a heated umbrella in the beer garden.

breweries.name: Sand Creek Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sand Creek Brewing Company began on a dairy farm in Downing, Wisconsin, about 20 miles northwest of the city of Menomonie. After homebrewing on the family farm for years, homebrewer Cory Schroeder teamed up with Jim Wiesender to found the brewery in 1999.

Using equipment scrounged from various industries, such as a converted pudding tank for the brew kettle, the pair launched a successful business, brewing the beer just steps away from the chicken coop and a busy dairy farm.

Their Sand Creek Golden Ale and English Style Special Ale, available only on draft and in half-gallon growlers, soon developed a reputation throughout Wisconsin's many brew fests. With a capacity of only about 150 barrels per year, the brewery, now with a third owner on board, quickly outgrew the little farm shed converted into a brewhouse.

Hoping to remain in the Dunn/St. Croix counties area, the company looked for a suitable place to relocate, but came up empty handed. Then opportunity knocked in the form of a phone call one evening from their friend in Black River Falls, Pioneer brewing's brewmaster Todd Krueger. The brewery was for sale.

In March of 2004 the combined forces of the two breweries officially formed the new Sand Creek Brewing Co. of Black River Falls, Wisconsin.

data.name: So I Bitter
data.description: Light in body and color this ESB is crisp and very drinkable. Nice esters on the nose, we fermented with an English yeast strain hopped with Sterling, Saaz, and Noble hops.

breweries.name: Adventure Brewery
breweries.description:
We started officially brewing in January 2012, though we brewed for ourselves long before that. With so much great feedback we concluded it would be a crime not to share our passion for beer with everyone. We've been heavily influenced by so many beers particularly by breweries from the 1800's that have now long-since closed their doors. Heritage is important to us and all our beers are made with a definitive nod to the brewers and breweries of former times. If we can develop great beer and give people a history lesson at the same time we would be two very happy brewers!

We regularly produce a range of four core beers (North, South, West and East) and North Pole is brewed for the festive season. We also brew a new limited edition beer each month, produced in small batches and aimed the drinker wanting something just a little bit different. You can find reviews of our core range here, and the first of our limited edition beers here.

So, join us on our Adventure! Be it bottle or cask...

data.name: Special
data.description: Sharp's Special was first brewed by Bill Sharp in 1996 to indulge local demand for a lavish, strong beer that would fulfil and satisfy during the testing Cornish winter. Still brewed to the original recipe Special is now revered by connoisseurs as one of the world's finest Special bitters, a reputation recently enhanced by the Special's acheivements in some of the world's most prestigous brewing competitions.

style.name: Special Bitter or Best Bitter
style.description: Special bitter is more robust than ordinary bitter. It has medium body and medium residual malt sweetness. It is deep gold to copper colored. Hop bitterness should be medium and absent of harshness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels. The absence of diacetyl is also acceptable. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

data.name: Special Bitter
data.description: Our Traditional English Style Bitter with English Pale Malts, and imported Goldings hops served on Nitrogen for a Smooth richer Malt flavor and a Creamy Finish.

breweries.name: Moylan's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Moylan’s Brewery & Restaurant, Novato’s only brewpub, was $3.5 million project that has established a strong following among North Marin’s beer connoisseurs. Moylan’s features a 57 foot long bar, a dart room with a fireplace and a reading library featuring brewing books and magazines from Brendan’s personal collection. By constructing the brewpub in an empty lot from his own vision, Moylan was able to increase efficiency and productivity, while still leaving room for expansion as the establishment’s popularity grows. According to Moylan, the location at Rowland Plaza provides good freeway visibility and helps attract a greater number of customers from the nearby theatre and corporate offices. When Moylan co-founded Marin Brewing Company back in 1989 there were only about a 100 brewpubs across the country. Today, there are more than 2000.

data.name: THE MAYOR OF GARRATT
data.description:
Style: Best Bitter
Abv: 4.3%
Colour: Bronze
Description: A truely London Bitter brewed in the most traditional way. This best bitter is brewed with British Malt, Yeast and Hops, with London water, passion and heritage.

History: The tradition of electing a ‘Mayor of Garratt’ evolved only a stones throw away from our brewery during the early 18th century. These popular mock elections, which attracted huge crowds, were held at the same time as elections to Parliament. They centred upon our local pubs, The Leather Bottle and Old Sergeant. The candidates were, typically, unconventional colourful characters from London who adopted comic names and made witty speeches. The event provided a platform for free speech, a protest against the ruling classes and of course, mandatory drunken revelry! This beer is a nod to this truly original eccentric English tradition.

breweries.name: By The Horns Brewing Co
breweries.description:
By The Horns Brewing Co. began its humble start with two friends brewing beers they loved on a homebrew kit in their garage. Beers were brewed on Sunday mornings, where biscuity malt and hop aromas would waft through their house waking up their two other housemates. Before too long they realised they wanted to brew these beers every day of the week and share their passion of brewing and drinking good beer with the rest of London.

Recipes were put together, brewing vessels were purchased, an industrial premises was let and the brewery in Summerstown, London, was born. Alex Bull and Chris Mills, the co-founders, had put together a microbrewery based in South-West London which created small-batch full-flavoured ales. Initially, four flagship ales were brewed for cask ale and bottles, with new on-off limited edition beers being created every month.

Within 18 months of operation the brewery was expanded with new vessels installed and a Brewery Tap was added. The expansion enabled keg beers to be produced, including a variety of lagers and stronger craft keg beers, with our Brewery Tap serving our beers directly from where they are brewed.­
We now produce four flagship ales and at least three varying seasonal ales every month. We also produce five flagship bottle beers which are sold to many of London’s finest beer bottle shops and also have two flagship keg beer(our Crafty Lager 5.3% & Wolfie Smith Amber Ale 5.2%) with four seasonal kegs beers.

breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

data.name: Timmy T's English Pale
data.description: This is a very traditional interpretation of a pale ale. Originally, pale ales were designed to showcase the beauty of the beer upon the invention of affordable clear glass drinking vessels. Over the years, more and more hops were added to the style. This is a very delicate, very British version. Light earthy and grassy hop character accentuates the bready maltiness, lending to a very drinkable beer.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Toothy Grin
data.description: Despite the name, this quaffable brew isn’t really all that bitter. A full malt flavor is balanced with earthy East Kent Goldings hops and fruity esters from a classic British yeast strain. We serve our bitter on Nitro, giving it a creamy head and a silky mouthfeel, just the way they’ve done it across the pond for generations.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Open Daily 5-Close

data.name: Trashy Blonde
data.description:
A titillating, neurotic, peroxide, punk of a pale ale. Combining attitude, style substance and a little bit of low self esteem for good measure; what would your mother say?

You really should just leave it alone...

...but you just cant get the compulsive malt body and gorgeous dirty blonde colour out of your head. The seductive lure of the sassy passion fruit hop proves too much to resist. All that is even before we get onto the fact that there are no additives preservatives, pasteurization or strings attached.

All wrapped up with the customary Brewdog bite and imaginative twist. This trashy blonde is going to get you into a lot of trouble.

breweries.name: BrewDog Ltd
breweries.description:
BrewDog is a Scottish craft brewery located in the town of Fraserburgh, Aberdeenshire.

BrewDog was founded in 2006 by friends James Watt and Martin Dickie. The brewery at the Kessock Industrial Estate in Fraserburgh produced its first brew in April 2007. It is Scotland's largest independently owned brewery producing about 120,000 bottles per month for export all over the world.

breweries.name: Wells and Young's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Wells and Young's Brewing Company is the epitome of all-round business excellence, demonstrating sustained growth for its beers and stockists whilst combining traditional family values with innovation and development. 

Firmly placed as the UK's largest private brewing company, it is fiercely independent, and with an enviable portfolio of some of the UK's most loved cask beers and speciality lager brands.

data.name: Winkle Picker
data.description: A beautifully balanced amber Best Bitter; Winkle Picker’s maltiness offset by a firm but not overpowering bitterness and a delightful hint of orange delivers everything one could desire from a classic British Bitter.

data.description: A pleasingly warming beer with its amber hue showing off its rich malt heritage. Mildly bittered with a smooth hop flavor complementing the malt. Winter Skål makes a person welcome the onslaught of the cold.

breweries.name: Capital Brewery
breweries.description:
Located in a former egg processing plant building, Capital Brewery produced its first brew at 6:30 pm, April 17, 1986.

The brewhouse features two copper brewing kettles. These units, now over 50 years old, were originally used at the former Hoxter Brewery located in Germany.

At the heart of the operation is a group of loyal and hard working employees dedicated to producing the high quality beer that Capital Brewery is known for.

Most of the beers brewed here at Capital consist of traditional ingredients, water, malted barley and wheat, hops and yeast. However, we do believe in experimentation to develop unique beer styles and varieties. We invite you to enjoy one of our beers in our brewery or take some home for a true Capital experience.


Capital Brewery was established with an important mission in mind, and we continually build on that sentiment, by delivering a unique experience and award winning beers to meet the changing demands of the craft beer community.

data.name: Wren's Bitter
data.description: don’t let the name fool you, this is a smooth sessionable English Pale Ale. British Maris Otter malt, and a hint of Continental caramel malt provides a bready malt backbone and East Kent Goldings hops provide the flavorful hop nose. Characterful English yeast leaves a slightly fruity taste that pairs well with the sweet, spicy, floral hops. Balance is to bitterness, but does not overpower the malt flavor, esters and hop flavors of this English classic.

style.name: Special Bitter or Best Bitter
style.description: Special bitter is more robust than ordinary bitter. It has medium body and medium residual malt sweetness. It is deep gold to copper colored. Hop bitterness should be medium and absent of harshness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels. The absence of diacetyl is also acceptable. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

breweries.name: Tin Cannon Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are a small brewery that manufactures and sells beer in our tap room. We will be brewing on a 2 barrel (bbl) system when we open - 60 gallons per batch brewed.

Tin Cannon founders John Hilkert and Aaron Ludwig started out as a home brewers. John and Aaron met at church through their kids, who were (and still are) best friends. The kids would plan brew days at Aaron's house so they could play together, and John and Aaron could brew. John had started brewing on a beer kit and Aaron taught him the art of brewing all grain beers on his home made system. The planning of Tin Cannon came through many days of brewing with together in Aaron's dedicated brew room, or in John's garage. Aaron is an engineering guru and built a tremendous 10 gallon brewing system on his own, to include an electric master control panel. John likes to tinker and build stuff, and built stir plates, mash tuns, a kegerator and the like. When two innovative minds get together, they bring ingenuity, focus, style and creativity to each beer they brew. That's what you can expect to get when you come to Tin Cannon Brewing Co.

breweries.name: Adventure Brewery
breweries.description:
We started officially brewing in January 2012, though we brewed for ourselves long before that. With so much great feedback we concluded it would be a crime not to share our passion for beer with everyone. We've been heavily influenced by so many beers particularly by breweries from the 1800's that have now long-since closed their doors. Heritage is important to us and all our beers are made with a definitive nod to the brewers and breweries of former times. If we can develop great beer and give people a history lesson at the same time we would be two very happy brewers!

We regularly produce a range of four core beers (North, South, West and East) and North Pole is brewed for the festive season. We also brew a new limited edition beer each month, produced in small batches and aimed the drinker wanting something just a little bit different. You can find reviews of our core range here, and the first of our limited edition beers here.

So, join us on our Adventure! Be it bottle or cask...

data.name: Younger’s Best
data.description: Younger’s Best is a satisfyingly good value pint. It’s high in quality and comes with the reassurance of Younger’s tradition and heritage.

breweries.name: Wells and Young's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Wells and Young's Brewing Company is the epitome of all-round business excellence, demonstrating sustained growth for its beers and stockists whilst combining traditional family values with innovation and development. 

Firmly placed as the UK's largest private brewing company, it is fiercely independent, and with an enviable portfolio of some of the UK's most loved cask beers and speciality lager brands.
